description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A DORMER ROOF EXTENSION AND INSERTION OF X2 ROOFLIGHTS TO FRONT ROOFSLOPE
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The erection of a rear roof extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The insertion of x2 rooflights to front roof slope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a certificate of lawfulnss only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
In order to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (Schedule 2, Class B, Condition B.2, paragraph (a)), the applicant is reminded that the external materials of the dormer window must have a similar appearance to the external materials of the existing roof.
